title: Our early primer for the divisional round matchups: How every team could win next weekend
content: Let's preview the divisional round matchups. How can each team win next weekend and advance? Here's what to know.

title: 49ers lose Kittle but carry his 'energy' to win
content: Despite another devastating injury to a team captain, the 49ers embodied the spirit of George Kittle to help will themselves to a playoff win over the Eagles.

title: Maye 'didn't throw very well,' pins win on defense
content: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye wasn't thrilled with his performance in Sunday's 16-3 wild-card victory over the Chargers. "Wasn't pretty, that's for sure," he said.

title: Sirianni defends Brown after drops, sideline spat
content: Eagles coach Nick Sirianni defended wide receiver A.J. Brown after a pair of drops in Sunday's loss to the Niners and also downplayed an animated interaction the two had in the opening half.

title: Herbert takes blame for Chargers' latest ouster
content: The Los Angeles Chargers' season ended Sunday with a loss to the New England Patriots, and Justin Herbert took responsibility for the poor performance, telling reporters after the 16-3 defeat, "I didn't play well enough and didn't make any plays."

title: QB Chambliss' eligibility fight heads to state court
content: Lawyers for Trinidad Chambliss plan to file suit against the NCAA in Mississippi state court this week for a preliminary injunction that will aim to secure the quarterback's eligibility for 2026.

title: Ant sinks winner to cap wild Wolves rally vs. Spurs
content: Anthony Edwards put the finishing touches on a wild, comeback win for Minnesota over San Antonio, a game they opened by trailing 16-0.

title: 'Warrior' Allen helps get Bills over hump on road
content: Fourth-quarter comebacks happen to be an important part of the team's success this season -- all behind quarterback Josh Allen -- and that continued Sunday as the reigning MVP led the Bills past the Jaguars in the AFC wild-card round 27-24.

title: Irish deny battery allegation against Freeman
content: Notre Dame has denied that Marcus Freeman made physical contact with anyone after the football coach was accused of battery in a police report filed Jan. 3.

title: üëÄ Offseason guide for all eliminated NFL teams
content: The NFL offseason has arrived for 20 teams. What must each do to have a better season in 2026? We have outlooks, early buzz and predictions.

title: 'Not sure why they felt the need': NBA execs on the Trae deal and trade season's next move
content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst survey the league on the Young deal and what comes next for the Wizards and Hawks.

title: Everything to know about the U.S. Olympic figure skating team
content: The U.S. Olympic figure skating team was named Sunday -- and could dominate at the Milan Cortina Olympics in less than a month.

title: JuJu Watkins makes history as Sierra Canyon's first jersey retirement
content: The USC standout became the first athlete in Sierra Canyon's history to receive the honor after a decorated three-year run.

title: How the Steelers forged Aaron Rodgers-Mike Tomlin connection
content: The bond between QB and coach has led Pittsburgh to its first home playoff game since the 2020 season.

title: 'Hungry for more': 49ers' petty posts at Eagles tops NFL wild-card trolls
content: The NFL wild-card round had its fair share of petty posts after big wins, led by the San Francisco 49ers.

title: With no manager, Manchester United continue to sink to new lows
content: In a season full of lows, Manchester United's early FA Cup exit only deepens their misery, denying them any chance of silverware this season.

title: WNBA, WNBPA fail to reach new CBA at deadline
content: The WNBA and its players' union failed to agree to a new collective bargaining agreement or an extension of the previous one by Friday's 11:59 p.m. ET deadline.

title: Solak: The Bears are a second-half team, and you can never count them out
content: Perhaps we shouldn't be surprised the Bears came back to beat the Packers. They've been doing this all season.

title: From future HOF pitchers to a veteran catcher: Best fits for under-the-radar MLB free agents
content: Did your favorite team miss out on the biggest stars of this winter? Here are 15 players to sign instead.

title: Power Rankings: Where every team stands in the new year
content: Though there are still free agents to be signed, let's reassess the standings midway through the offseason.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Gu√©hi prefers Bayern move over Man City
content: Marc Gu√©hi prefers a move to Bayern over Man City. Plus, Man United hope to name an interim manager within the next 48 hours. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: All About 16 Satellites Lost In Space After Setback For ISRO Workhorse PSLV
content: The 44.4 metre-tall four-stage rocket lifted off as scheduled at 10.18 am from the spaceport in Andhra Pradesh's Sriharikota, in what was ISRO's first mission of 2026.

title: US Woman Killed By ICE Agent Was Called A "Domestic Terrorist": What It Means
content: Renee Nicole Good was killed after she allegedly refused to exit her car and attempted to use her vehicle against an officer, according to Kristi Noem. The claims have been disputed in videos circulating online.

title: Class 12 Student Kidnapped, Gang-Raped Inside Moving Car In Rajasthan
content: A Class 12 girl student was allegedly kidnapped and gang-raped inside a moving car in Rajasthan's Bikaner district, police said on Monday.

title: Why Gold Paste Smuggling Has Become Smugglers Weapon Of Choice In India
content: With the prices of gold skyrocketing, India is witnessing a significant increase in the number of smuggling cases.

title: Himachal Merchant Navy Officer Detained From Russian Tanker A Month Before Wedding
content: Rikshit Chauhan, a merchant navy officer from Himachal Pradesh's Kangra district, was set to return home soon for his wedding next month before the Russian-flagged oil tanker was seized by United States forces in the North Atlantic last week.

title: Pics: Frozen Waterfall Draws Tourists In Gulmarg, Cold Wave Persists In J&K
content: A large number of tourists flocked to a partially frozen waterfall in Jammu and Kashmir's Gulmarg, even as minimum temperatures rose in the Valley but cold wave conditions persisted.

title: PSLV's Big Comeback Hit By Stage 3 Snag Again, Just Like 2025
content: At 10.18 am today, the Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle (PSLV)-C62 rocket, carrying 16 satellites, lifted off from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre in Sriharikota

title: "Trump May Visit Next Year": US Says No Country More Essential Than India
content: No other nation is as essential to the United States as India, said US ambassador-designate Sergio Gor, as he announced that Washington and New Delhi are set to restart their next round of trade deal talks from Tuesday (January 12).

title: 'Not Even President...': Plea Against Lifetime Immunity To Poll Officers
content: The petition argued that the law "harms free and fair elections" and asked the court to immediately stay the provision.

title: From George Floyd To Renee Good: 5 Years, 2 Videos, US Police In Spotlight
content: Five years ago, video images from a Minneapolis street showing a police officer kneeling on the neck of George Floyd as his life slipped away ignited a social movement.

title: No VIP Quota, Local Cuisine: All About First Vande Bharat Sleeper Train
content: According to official sources, the Vande Bharat Sleeper train - India's first - will be for the general public and VIP or emergency quota will not be allowed.

title: German Chancellor In India LIVE: PM Modi Hails India-Germany Ties After Meeting With Merz
content: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz's India Tour LIVE: Merz's visit from Monday -- his first to an Asian country since he took office last May -- comes two weeks ahead of a planned EU-India summit.

title: 2 Shooters, 5 Others Arrested In AAP Sarpanch Murder Case
content: Punjab Police on Monday said it has arrested two shooters and five other accused in the murder case of an AAP sarpanch who was killed at a wedding in Amritsar on January 4.

title: Telangana Man, 80, Who Built His Own Grave Dies, Laid To Rest
content: An 80-year-old man in Telangana, who built his own grave while leading a healthy life, passed away on January 11.

title: Indian Army Officer Wins UN Award For Gender-Inclusive Peacekeeping
content: Major Swathi Shantha Kumar, an Indian Army officer from Bengaluru currently serving with the UN Mission in South Sudan, has been awarded the prestigious UN Secretary-Generals Award 2025 for her contribution to gender-inclusive peacekeeping

title: Walmart CEO, Who Is Set To Retire, Earns Rs 1.4 Lakh Every 30 Minutes
content: When Doug McMillon started working at Walmart in 1984, he earned $6.50 per hour (about Rs 585) unloading trailers in the company's warehouses.

title: Air India Flight Diverted To Jaipur Due To Medical Emergency
content: An Air India flight from the national capital to Vijayawada was diverted to Jaipur due to a medical emergency on Monday morning, according to a source.

title: Air Strike To Starlink Support: What Are Trump's Iran Options?
content: US President Donald Trump has said that the United States is closely monitoring the unrest in Iran and is mulling "potential options" as the Islamic Republic faces its third week of nationwide protests against the theocratic regime led by Khamenei.

title: "Shameless, Illegal And Immoral": North Korea Slams US At UN
content: North Korea condemned on Monday what it called "shameless" moves by the United States that it said undermined the United Nations and accused Washington of a "hideous criminal act".

title: 'Will come to Mumbai, try cutting my legs': Annamalai fires back at Raj Thackeray; slams ‚Äòrasmalai‚Äô jab
content: BJP leader K Annamalai dared MNS chief Raj Thackeray to stop him from entering Mumbai after receiving threats, including those of physical harm. Thackeray had earlier mocked Annamalai and questioned his connection to Mumbai, while also vowing to expel Bihari and UP migrants imposing Hindi.

title: 'Have to maintain decorum': Om Birla slams Kirti Azad for vaping inside Parliament; adds 'action soon'
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla announced disciplinary action against TMC MP Kirti Azad for allegedly vaping in the House. Birla emphasized maintaining parliamentary decorum, stating that violations will be punished under established rules.

title: '40 balls daily daalne hain, batting ke baad': How Ayush Badoni earned maiden India call-up
content: Ayush Badoni received a maiden India call-up for the remaining ODIs against New Zealand, replacing an injured Washington Sundar. His coach highlighted Badoni's dedication to improving his off-spin bowling, a skill he developed through rigorous practice. Badoni's all-round abilities and leadership experience also contributed to his selection.

title: 'You can't align what you can't control': Microsoft AI boss warns rivals
content: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman urges the industry to prioritize containment over alignment in AI development, warning against pursuing superintelligence without first ensuring control. He advocates for a "Humanist Superintelligence" approach, focusing on practical applications like medical AI and clean energy, to maintain human oversight and avoid uncontrolled autonomous systems.

title: ‚ÄòTop attack capability against moving target‚Äô: DRDO tests anti-tank guided missile ‚Äî watch
content: DRDO successfully flight tested its third-generation Man Portable Anti-Tank Guided Missile (MPATGM) with top-attack capability. The shoulder-launched missile, weighing approximately 14.5 kg, demonstrated a precise strike on a moving target's upper surface during trials in Maharashtra. This indigenously developed system features advanced technologies for effective tank and armored vehicle neutralization.

title: 'It's not a great feeling': Virat Kohli speaks out on crowd cheers after teammate's wicket
content: India's master batter Virat Kohli expressed discomfort with fans cheering his arrival at the crease upon a batter's dismissal, a practice he finds disheartening for the departing player. Despite this, Kohli remains grateful for fan support and focused on team victory, as demonstrated by his match-winning 93 in India's chase.

title: Marinera crisis: Merchant navy officer caught up in seizure of Russian tanker; kin seek PM's help
content: Rakshit Chauhan, a 26‚Äëyear‚Äëold merchant navy officer from Palampur in Himachal Pradesh‚Äôs Kangra district, is among three Indian nationals detained after a Russian‚Äëflagged oil tanker was seized by the United States in the North Atlantic on January 7. Rakshit, on his first sea assignment with a Russian employer and posted to the Marinera tanker bound for Venezuela, was stopped at sea after the US Coast Guard intercepted the vessel amid broader sanctions enforcement.

title: Trump may ask Musk to help: US president mulls Starlink for Iran blackout; protests fuel crisis
content: US President Donald Trump plans to contact Elon Musk regarding Iran's internet blackout.  The country has been offline since January 8, 2026.  This shutdown is more severe than previous ones.  Even Starlink, a lifeline during past protests, is reportedly jammed.  Meanwhile, Iran's supreme leader continued posting online.  Protests over rising prices began in December, leading to many deaths and arrests.

title: Rare moment for gulf skies: International Space Station visible over Qatar for 6 minutes
content: Skywatchers in Qatar witnessed the International Space Station (ISS) streak across the evening sky on January 11, 2026. Visible to the naked eye for about six minutes after sunset, the fast-moving, bright light captivated observers and sparked widespread sharing on social media, offering a tangible connection to human achievement in space.

title: IND vs NZ: Ayush Badoni earns maiden ODI call-up as Washington Sundar ruled out of series
content: India's ODI series against New Zealand faces disruption as Washington Sundar is ruled out due to a rib injury sustained in the first match. Young batter Ayush Badoni earns his maiden national call-up as his replacement. This setback follows Rishabh Pant's earlier withdrawal, highlighting ongoing injury concerns for the Indian squad.

title: How Cholesterol can power tomorrow's devices
content: Indian researchers have discovered that cholesterol, a waxy molecule, can control electron spin, a property crucial for future spintronic devices. By incorporating metal ions into cholesterol-based structures, scientists can tune the spin preference of electrons, paving the way for more efficient and sustainable electronics.

title: India-Germany trade: PM Modi, German chancellor Merz meet CEOs; aim to boost economic ties
content: Prime Minister Modi and German Chancellor Merz met in Ahmedabad, highlighting robust economic and strategic ties. Bilateral trade has surpassed $50 billion, with over 2,000 German companies operating in India. The leaders also agreed to establish an India-Germany Centre of Excellence to boost technology and clean energy collaboration.

title: Connor McDavid‚Äôs wife Lauren Kyle confirms delay in Sports Club Atelier collection
content: Lauren Kyle, founder of Sports Club Atelier and wife of Connor McDavid, shared an update on her upcoming collaboration with Hockey Canada, confirming a slight delay in the launch. She emphasized the importance of getting every detail right. The collection follows the success of her earlier releases, which blend hockey culture with luxury streetwear.

title: Vanessa Bryant thanks fans for braving rain at emotional Mamba book signing
content: Vanessa Bryant recently hosted a 'Mamba & Mambacita Forever' book signing, drawing large crowds despite rain. The event celebrated Kobe and Gianna Bryant's enduring legacy through art and community. Fans shared personal stories, highlighting how Vanessa's foundation continues to inspire and provide sports opportunities for underserved youth, honoring her family's memory.

title: Ayesha Curry promotes Jamaican tourism after devastating hurricane
content: Ayesha Curry is urging fans to support Jamaica's recovery from Hurricane Melissa by visiting the island. She highlighted that tourism is crucial for the Jamaican economy, with nearly 30% of the workforce dependent on it. Curry emphasized that a vacation serves as a donation, with airports and most hotels now operational.

title: IND vs NZ: Chase Kings! India first team to hunt down 300-plus targets 20 times in ODIs
content: India achieved a historic four-wicket victory over New Zealand in the first ODI, successfully chasing down a target of 301. This win marked their 20th successful pursuit of 300-plus totals in ODIs, a world record. Virat Kohli's 93 anchored the chase, with crucial late contributions from Harshit Rana and KL Rahul sealing the win.

title: Eagles fans face renewed scrutiny as Wild Card incidents revive 'worst fans' label
content: Eagles fans faced national scrutiny during their Wild Card game against the 49ers on January 11, 2026, after allegations of throwing beer cans at opposing supporters. This incident followed a Philadelphia sports bar's viral refusal to host 49ers fans, reigniting debates about fan behavior and the line between passion and perception.

title: Trump tariffs: Sergio Gor says India-US deal decision due tomorrow
content: India-US trade deal: US Ambassador to India Sergio Gor said trade deal talks are ongoing, with both sides actively engaged and the next discussion scheduled for tomorrow.

title: I-PAC raids: ED makes big charge against Mamata in SC; accuses CM of destroying evidence
content: The Enforcement Directorate has approached the Supreme Court. It seeks an FIR against West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, the DGP, and the Kolkata Police Commissioner. The agency alleges obstruction and evidence tampering in a money laundering case. This involves a probe into the political consultancy firm I-PAC. The ED claims its officers were threatened and evidence was seized.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO day 39 Vs 'The Raja Saab' day 4: The Ranveer Singh film crosses Rs 800cr
content: 'Dhurandhar' continues its strong run into its sixth weekend, outperforming 'The Raja Saab' in the Hindi belt. Despite a slight dip on Friday due to the new release, 'Dhurandhar's' weekend collections remain impressive. The film is projected to finish significantly ahead of 'Pushpa 2' in net collections, with a notable surprise in Mysore/Karnataka.

title: Meet the Chef from Bihar who is turning 'poor man‚Äôs food‚Äô into power dishes
content: Chef Gautam Kumar, once feeling like a misfit from rural Bihar, defied expectations to become a celebrated chef. He transformed his perceived disadvantages into strengths, championing ancient Indian culinary wisdom, particularly Ayurveda, in elite kitchens.

title: It‚Äôs a first! Budget 2026 to be presented on a Sunday; Om Birla confirms date
content: Marking a historic first, the Union Budget for 2026 will be presented on Sunday, February 1st. Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla confirmed the date, with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman set to table the budget for the eighth time. The Budget Session, commencing January 28th, will see this significant financial announcement on a weekend.

title: Two World C'ships: 'It's so complex' ‚Äì Can Total Chess Tour shrug off 'copycat' tag?
content: Elite chess is experiencing a surge of "World Championships" with two major announcements: the Total Chess World Championship Tour and the FIDE Freestyle Chess World Championship. Both promise global reach and significant prize money, leading to comparisons and player confusion. The execution of these ambitious tours will determine their success and impact on the chess landscape.

title: SC plea on censor certificate: Makers challenge Madras HC stay; release fate uncertain
content: Thalapathy Vijay's final film, 'Jana Nayagan,' faces release delays due to a censorship dispute. Makers have approached the Supreme Court after the Madras High Court overturned a previous order allowing certification. This legal battle, involving senior lawyers, aims for a swift resolution to ensure the film hits theaters soon, a highly anticipated event for fans.

title: Your heart doesn‚Äôt care how young you are: Myths busted by cardiologists
content: Heart disease is a silent killer, affecting younger individuals due to modern lifestyles and prevalent myths. Cardiologists urge people to disregard misconceptions like 'too young' or 'no chest pain' as warning signs are often subtle. Ignoring these can lead to delayed treatment and dire consequences, emphasizing the critical need for early detection and proactive health management.

title: Buying a home or renovating? Why Biophilic design works best for urban apartments
content: Biophilic design is transforming urban apartments, bringing nature indoors to combat city stress and enhance well-being. This nature-inspired approach, integrating elements like vertical gardens and natural textures, is becoming a smart, science-based trend for apartment dwellers seeking peace and a healthier living environment.

title: Maha local body polls: Will NCP factions come together? Ajit Pawar, Sule don‚Äôt rule it out
content: Speculation of a permanent merger between the two NCP factions is growing after Ajit Pawar and Supriya Sule hinted at a possible reunion. Both leaders stated that the current alliance is for upcoming local body elections, with decisions on a permanent merger to be made later. This comes amid apparent cracks within the ruling Mahayuti alliance.

title: Scientists develop injection to turn tumor immune cells into cancer fighters
content: Scientists have developed a novel therapy that converts existing immune cells within tumors into potent anticancer fighters. This innovative approach utilizes CAR-macrophages, which are adept at infiltrating dense tumors and signaling other immune cells to join the fight. Early clinical trials show promise for treating solid cancers with fewer side effects.

title: Malayalam Language Bill 2025: What happens when language laws enter schools
content: The Malayalam Language Bill 2025 has triggered an inter-state dispute not over identity, but over schooling. By making Malayalam compulsory as a first language in Classes 1‚Äì10, the law raises questions about how safeguards for linguistic minorities will work in border districts like Kasaragod. The debate turns on a familiar fault line: Where language promotion ends, and classroom compulsion begins.

title: ‚ÄòWe will hit them at levels ‚Ä¶‚Äô: Trump reacts to Iran‚Äôs threat to target US military bases
content: US President Donald Trump stated Washington is monitoring Iran's deadly protests and considering military retaliation, warning of unprecedented strikes if attacked. Iran's President accused the US and Israel of fomenting unrest, while the UN urged an end to the violent crackdown and restoration of internet access. Activists report over 544 deaths and thousands detained amid escalating violence.

title: 'No delivery is worth a life': Swiggy agent falls from moving train while delivering food; company responds
content: A Swiggy delivery partner narrowly escaped serious injury after falling from the Prashanti Express at Anantapur railway station. The incident occurred when the train began moving before the agent could safely exit after delivering food. This has raised concerns about gig worker safety during short-halt train deliveries.

title: Washington Sundar ruled out of ODI series due to injury
content: India faces a significant setback as all-rounder Washington Sundar is ruled out of the remaining ODIs against New Zealand due to a side strain. This injury casts doubt on his availability for the upcoming T20 series, adding to team concerns ahead of the T20 World Cup. The BCCI is expected to announce his replacement shortly.

title: Saif Ali Khan‚Äôs 16 acre land safe: Bhopal court upholds Pataudi family's ownership
content: A Bhopal court has dismissed a civil suit challenging the ownership of a 16.62-acre land parcel, ruling in favor of Saif Ali Khan, Sharmila Tagore, and other legal heirs of the royal family.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 trades below 25,500; Sensex down over 600 points
content: Indian stock benchmarks Nifty50 and Sensex opened lower on Monday, extending their decline for a fifth consecutive session. Investor sentiment was impacted by global trade concerns and political uncertainty. Meanwhile, Asian equities saw gains, building on a strong start to the year for global stocks.

title: Gold price prediction: Why are prices rallying & what's the next level to watch out?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are rallying this week, says Manav Modi of Motilal Oswal Financial Services Ltd. But what's the outlook for the coming week and what will be the key triggers? We take a look:

Unite for Marathi and Maharashtra."‚Äã‚Äã Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray and his cousin Raj Thackeray on Sunday mounted a joint attack on the rival BJP over what they described as ‚Äúfake Hindutva‚Äù at a rally held ahead of the civic polls.

title: Hidden drama in Team India's chase: KL Rahul says 'I didn't know ... '
content: KL Rahul revealed the significant challenge of managing India's run chase when Washington Sundar was unable to run effectively due to a back issue. Rahul had to balance aggression with caution, focusing on strike rotation and preventing dot balls to secure the win. His composure and strategic management proved crucial in the tense finish.

title: Karur stampede probe: Vijay appears before CBI; agency grills TVK chief over tragedy
content: Actor and TVK Chief Vijay appeared before the CBI in Delhi for questioning regarding the Karur stampede case. The investigation, now with the CBI following a Supreme Court order, concerns a tragic incident last September that resulted in 41 deaths and over 60 injuries during a political meeting.

title: Country shocked by JNU-like incidents: Delhi CM on sloganeering at university protest
content: Greeting youngsters on National Youth Day, Mr. Gupta said the entire country looks up to them as they have a crucial role in leading the nation towards progress.

content: Festival to be held from January 22 to 25, bringing together influential voices from across literature, art, science, culture, and public life

content: The HHRC had taken a suo motu cognisance of the deaths of two workers in Hansi in Haryana, who allegedly died after being forced to enter a hotel's septic tank without protective gear

content: The source said an elderly passenger became unwell onboard the flight AI2517, following which the flight was diverted to Jaipur, where the passenger was deboarded and taken to hospital.

content: The State Election Commission (SEC) announced that the elections for 29 municipal corporations in Maharashtra, including the BMC, will be held in a single phase on January 15, 2026.

content: The government has also allotted 300 acres to the company for setting up a captive solar power plant, enabling it to run its manufacturing facility on renewable, self-generated power

title: What does two PSLV mission failures in a row mean for ISRO? | Analysis
content: ISRO is aggressively pushing the PSLV as a commercial product; the rocket‚Äôs PS3 stage is a solid fuel motor and a technologically mature component; it shouldn‚Äôt fail, yet it has failed to perform as expected in two successive missions

title: Karnataka Excise Minister directs officials to prevent production of illicit liquor, hooch in Yadgir district
content: Minister R.B. Timmapur has directed officials to take stern action against persons involved in selling CH powder for use in making illicit liquor

content: According to the FIR, a drone-like object was seen flying near cattle shed of the jail between 4.20 pm and 4.30 pm on Saturday. The object later moved towards the women‚Äôs jail section

title: Should the age of consent be lowered?
content: While some argue that the current law criminalises consensual relationships among adolescents, others warn that lowering the age could undermine protections against child exploitation. title: Indore water contamination deaths: Blindspotting in India‚Äôs cleanest city
content: Contaminated drinking water, supplied through government-laid pipelines, led to a diarrhoea outbreak in Indore, killing at least 8 and affecting about 3,000 people. Mehul Malpani reports on unplanned parts of one of Madhya Pradesh‚Äôs most promising cities, the delays in laying pipelines, and the blame game that follows when deaths get international coverage

title: What's next for LaFleur, Brian Gutekunst after the Packers' wild-card loss?
content: the last time the Packers did anything with the contracts of coach Matt LaFleur and general manager Brian Gutekunst, it happened in relative secrecy . the news did not leak out until just before training camp in July that year . it was never clear why then-team president Mark Murphy tried to keep it a secret .
